snippet: Nokia's new Lumia smartphones are widely regarded as the Finnish handset maker's last stand before it cedes the smartphone battle to Apple and Google. But how are the phones selling? One estimate suggests that shipments so far are relatively small.
abstract: Nokia's new Lumia smartphones are widely regarded as the Finnish handset maker's last stand before it cedes the smartphone battle to Apple and Google. But how are the phones selling? One estimate suggests that shipments so far are relatively small.

headline.main: IDC Says Nokia Shipped 2.2 Million Lumia Phones Last Quarter
